posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Balancing lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Balancing that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with Balancing and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Balancing?

posts.author: RulesMaster
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Balancing are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

I've been playing a Tiefling Druid in my campaign, and I've noticed that Balancing really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around Balancing? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about Balancing. Based on my experience, it works differently.

posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how combat works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around combat? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

The way I understand the rules for combat, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.
